messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] *8 What do you recommend for families that cannot financ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/9/2008 11:57:33 PM Eastern Standard Time, fourslaterz@yahoo.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/9/2008 11:57:33 PM Eastern Standard Time,
fourslaterz@... writes:

<<<While I wish we could buy every Lego set out there, they seem satisfied.
They spend a lot of time talking about sets they want, but they understand
when we can't buy them.>>>



That sounds a lot like one of my (and Dave's) pastimes: "When I win the
lottery..." It's fun to think of all the things one could do and buy with
"unlimited" money (it's not really unlimited, but at our budget, some of those
lottery jackpots would be like unlimited to us). Mine so often start with
surprising people I love with things they want but can't afford or wouldn't buy for
themselves.... Cool charity things... Businesses that I've not seen... Kind of
like window shopping, I guess. No expectations, just fun imagining.

Peace,
De
